page.title: 18Local History
page.content: The local racecourse and airfield. Two of the outstanding features of our area is the fact that it contained both a race course and an airfield. In 1883 a number of local men got together to form the E.Riding Club and Racecourse Co.The site extended to 267 acres and was customary to see nobility frequenting it.There was room for 6000 in the stands and on the first day of racing acrowd of 14000 watched the 6 races.The company was dissolved in 1895 the reason being that too few punters turned up to watch. In 1909 Gustav Hemel flew into the Hedon airfield and thus culminated years of hard work in getting the idea of the airfield accepted.Again abright idea was not accepted largely because there was insufficint commercial traffic to make the venture viable.
